name: transmission network construction, electricity, high voltage direct current land cable | transmission network, electricity, high voltage direct current land cable | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/26064/documentation

This dataset represents the construction and decommissioning of 1 km transmission network high voltage direct current land cable. The service life of the network was assumed to be 40 years. For this period also maintenance is considered as a service. Default value for power losses at 50 % load sum up to 8.06E6 kWh/km. Different from the literature source recycling was modelled according to the cut-off approach.;The inventory was modelled according to Jorge, R., Hawkins, T.R., Hertwich, E.G. (2012): Life cycle assessment of electricity transmission and distribution - part 1: power lines and cables. Int J Life Cycle Assess 17: 9-15, supplementary material

The activity starts with cable production according to material composition (energy requirements for cable production not included) and cable laying. Maintenance is included as a service. Substations are not included.

This activity ends with the decommissioning of transmission network according to material composition.
category: F:Construction/42:Civil engineering/422:Construction of utility projects/4220:Construction of utility projects

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Time frame of the underlying literature sources
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: The scope of the underlying literature source is Europe
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: The voltage level is assumed to be 400 kV.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: LCI data on resource use and emissions for production of materials, installation, maintenance, and end of life were provided by the Danish utility company Energinet.dk. No data referring to cable manufacturing (assembly of components) were available, and hence this process was not included.

exchanges.description: high voltage direct current land cable (Cu conductor 400 kV)
